items.title: [Boing Boing] California is completely drought-free for the first time in 25 years
items.content_html:
For the first time since December 2000, not a single square mile of California is classified as dry on the U.S. Drought Monitor. The last time the state reached this threshold was 25 years ago, the LA Times reports.

A series of powerful winter storms and atmospheric rivers swept across the state starting in October, right on schedule ‚Äî unlike last year. — Read the rest

The post California is completely drought-free for the first time in 25 years appeared first on Boing Boing.

items.title: [Boing Boing] Ireland wants to give police spyware and facial recognition powers
items.content_html:
Ireland is introducing the Communications (Interception and Lawful Access) Bill to modernize its 1993 surveillance laws. The bill would let police intercept all forms of communication, including encrypted messages, deploy spyware with judicial approval, scan electronic devices, and use IMSI catchers to identify suspects, The Register reports. — Read the rest

The post Ireland wants to give police spyware and facial recognition powers appeared first on Boing Boing.

items.title: [Boing Boing] San Diego Comic-Con bans AI art after artist pushback
items.content_html:
San Diego Comic-Con reversed its AI-friendly art show policy within 24 hours of artist pushback, implementing a complete ban: "Material created by Artificial Intelligence (AI) either partially or wholly, is not allowed in the art show," 404 Media reports.

The previous policy had allowed AI art if marked as such and not for sale ‚Äî rules that had been in place since at least 2024. — Read the rest

The post San Diego Comic-Con bans AI art after artist pushback appeared first on Boing Boing.

items.title: [The Guardian ‚Äì Global Development] ‚ÄòA grenade under her pillow?‚Äô: the Filipino journalist jailed for six years without trial
items.content_html:
The arrest of Frenchie Mae Cumpio has been described as a ‚Äòtravesty of justice‚Äô. On Thursday a court will deliver its verdict, potentially sentencing her to 40 years in prison for alleged terrorism

  • Filipino journalist Frenchie Cumpio found guilty of terror financing in verdict rights groups call ‚Äòabsurd‚Äô

For weeks before the police came for her, Frenchie Mae Cumpio had noticed odd incidents. The Filipino journalist ‚Äì just 21 years old but already hosting a radio show and working as executive director of a local news website ‚Äì told colleagues that a stranger had begun turning up and asking after her at the boarding house where she lived. She was sent a bouquet of flowers designed for a grave. She reported that two men had been following her on a motorcycle.

Cumpio believed it was deliberate intimidation. She had recently published a series of reports after visiting poor rural farmers who said they were being harassed by army units in the region.

Continue reading...

The Filipino journalist ‚Äì just 21 years old but already hosting a radio show and working as executive director of a local news website ‚Äì told colleagues that a stranger had begun turning up and asking after her at the boarding house where she lived. items.title: [Boing Boing] Early Wikipedia logo designs included a book centipede mascot
items.content_html:
Before Wikipedia's familiar puzzle globe logo, these concepts were under consideration, including a book centipede (the "Wikipede"), a five-headed dragon, and more. I'm disappointed they didn't choose the strange yet enticing anthropomorphic Wikipede. It has an odd familiarity‚Äîlike a half-forgotten cartoon character you recognize instantly but can't quite place. — Read the rest

The post Early Wikipedia logo designs included a book centipede mascot appeared first on Boing Boing.
